p: Aneuploidies in sperm are passed on to the embryo and can be seen in preimplantation embryos, fetal losses and live births. The major contribution to human genome evolution, however, might derive from de novo single nucleotide variants, which is an order of magnitude higher in sperm than eggs. Moreover, de novo single nucleotide variants show a strong correlation with paternal age, with an additional two mutations accumulating per paternal year ( Table 2) [132]. Since paternal age is associated with an elevated incidence of psychiatric conditions in children, it has been suggested that some of the paternal-age related de novo single nucleotide variants may contribute towards this effect, since they occur in genes implicated in schizophrenia and autism [132].
